articles.author: Laila Bassam, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Hezbollah's flexible chain of command, together with its extensive tunnel network and a vast arsenal of missiles and weapons it has bolstered over the past year, is helping it weather unprecedented Israeli strikes, three sources familiar with the Lebanese militant group's operations said.
articles.title: Hezbollah's tunnels and flexible command weather Israel's deadly blows

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah said on Wednesday it fired a rocket targeting Mossad spy agency headquarters near Tel Aviv, which it blamed for the assassination of its leaders and the blowing up communications devices used by its members, in a new escalation that moved the arch-foes closer to full-fledged war.
articles.title: Lebanon's Hezbollah says it launched rocket targeting Mossad base near Tel Aviv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia has established a weapons programme in China to develop and produce long-range attack drones for use in the war against Ukraine, according to two sources from a European intelligence agency and documents reviewed by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Russia has secret war drones project in China, intel sources say

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Wednesday dismissed efforts by China and Brazil to end Russia's war in Ukraine, questioning why the pair were proposing an alternative to his own peace formula and warning: "You will not boost your power at Ukraine's expense."
articles.title: Zelenskiy takes aim at China, Brazil push for peace in Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Authorities were responding on Wednesday to a reported explosion at the Santa Maria Courthouse in California, according to the Santa Barbara County Sheriff's Office amid reports that a suspect was in custody.
articles.title: Explosion reported at courthouse in California, sheriff's office says

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Laila Bassam
articles.description: The United States is spearheading a new diplomatic effort to end hostilities in both Gaza and Lebanon, linking the two conflicts as part of a single initiative, six sources familiar with the initiative told Reuters.
articles.title: US leads new effort to end hostilities in Lebanon and Gaza, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze was disinvited from a reception for world leaders hosted by U.S. President Joe Biden during the United Nations General Assembly, Georgian media reported on Wednesday, in the latest blow to the once close U.S.-Georgian relationship.
articles.title: Georgian PM disinvited from Biden UN reception as relations sour

articles.author: David Ljunggren
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau looks set to survive a vote of confidence on Wednesday after his main political rival appeared to fail to muster enough support to end nine years of Liberal Party rule.
articles.title: Trudeau set to survive vote of confidence in Canadian parliament

articles.author: Emilie Madi
articles.description: After evacuating her family from the village of Seddiqine in southern Lebanon, Feryal Mehsen went back to fetch belongings. It was then that an Israeli airstrike hit close by.
articles.title: Displaced Lebanese recount their ordeal of Israeli strikes and escape

articles.author: Rich McKay, Brendan O'Brien
articles.description: Powerful storm Helene officially became a hurricane on Wednesday morning, the National Hurricane Center said, packing maximum sustained winds of 80 mph (130 kph) as it churned in the eastern Gulf of Mexico just off the coast of the Yucatan Peninsula.
articles.title: Helene gains hurricane strength as it lashes Cuba, takes aim at Florida
